images.caption: Figure 1:A programming problem excerpted from the HumanEval[19]benchmark (#test25). This illustrates a scenario where defining properties can more robustly guide code correction than relying on limited example tests, motivating our approach.
Figure 2:Overview of the Property-Generated Solver framework, showcasing the iterative collaboration between the Generator and the Tester.
Figure 3:The prompt template used by the Tester to generate validation and input generator.
Figure 4:The prompt template used by the Generator to generate initial code and refine buggy code.

Figure 5:Contribution of different testing and refinement stages to overall problem resolution on the LiveCodeBench (DeepSeek-R1-Distilled-32B) and HumanEval (Deepseek-Coder-V2). The PBT segment highlights its incremental contribution to achieving comprehensive correctness.

Figure 6:Comparison of code generation outcome distributions (%) on LiveCodeBench with DeepSeek-R1-Distilled-32B. Categories include Pass, Runtime Error (incl. property violations), Wrong Answer, and TLE.
